title: The Real Meaning of Farting

title: A little thought experiment
self_text: Let's say you have a machine that will kill and torture someone, but will save the lives of ten people. Would it be right to use it? I guess not, because killing is wrong even if it saves other people. But what if the ten people were all terrorists who are about to detonate bombs in schools?  Would it still be wrong?  I guess not, because those people would die anyway. So we can kill people if they're bad enough. What about if the ten people are just criminals? Or if they're just homeless people? Or if they're just poor people? And where do we draw the line? Is there such a thing as "good" and "bad"?  Is morality subjective? Are we all just animals?

title: I think I'm going crazy, what should I do?
self_text: Hello! I am a person who has been diagnosed with schizophrenia for 1 year now and have been on antipsychotic medication ever since. About a month ago, my doctor started me on another medication called clozapine to help reduce my symptoms further. It seems like it is helping, but lately I've been experiencing some strange things that are making me wonder if I'm losing touch with reality again. Sometimes, when I look at people, their faces seem distorted or they appear to be looking right through me. Other times, I hear voices whispering in my ear that aren't there. I know these could be side effects of the medication, but it's still scary to experience them. I feel like everyone around me is judging me and plotting against me, even though I know logically that isn't true. I'm starting to become paranoid and anxious all the time, and it's interfering with my ability to function normally. I can barely sleep anymore because I'm constantly worried about what might happen next. I'm afraid to go outside or interact with other people, fearing that something bad will happen. Has anyone else experienced similar symptoms while taking clozapine or other antipsychotics? What did you do to cope with these feelings and regain your sense of reality? Any advice would be greatly appreciated.  I also want to mention that I'm not currently under any immediate threat of harming myself or others, but I'm concerned about where this is heading if things continue to worsen. I just need to know if this is normal and how long it usually takes for these side effects to subside.

title: I did not say the N word...I said a name!
self_text: 10 years ago, my mom and dad were talking about a man who had been killed by a bullet in the neck while driving down the street. My mom was telling me how sad it was to hear that someone died like that. She said his name was "Nate". But then my dad corrected her and said he went by "Nick" instead of Nate. Then she got mad at him because she thought he was mocking the dead man's name. And so they started fighting over whether or not my dad was racist. It has haunted me for 10 years, and now every time I hear the letter "N", I can't help but think of what happened. I have always wondered why my dad would correct my mom about the victim's name when everyone knows people go by nicknames. Now I know why. He hates black people.

title: I want to buy a computer but I am not sure what parts I need.
self_text: You need the following parts for a desktop computer: • Motherboard (the main circuit board) • CPU (Central Processing Unit, the brain of the computer) • GPU (Graphics Processing Unit, renders images and videos) • RAM (Random Access Memory, temporary storage for data) • Storage (hard drive or SSD, permanent storage for files) • Power supply (provides power to all components) • Case (houses all components) • Operating system (software that manages hardware resources)  You can find these parts online at retailers like Amazon, Newegg, and Best Buy. Be sure to do your research before purchasing any parts to ensure they are compatible with each other.

title: The best and only way to make a woman want you is to be rich or famous
self_text: A woman will never love a man that she doesn't respect, so if you want her to love you then you need to have something that makes her respect you. If you don't have anything like money or fame, then you can try to get a degree or learn a skill but it will take years of hard work and dedication.  But the easiest way to get a woman to love you is to be rich or famous. Women are attracted to men who have power and status, and they will often overlook other flaws in a man if he has these qualities. So if you want to find a wife, then I recommend that you focus on making money or becoming famous. It's the best and only way to make a woman want you.

title: R A D I U S F R O M H E L L
self_text: The radius of the sun is approximately 695,000 kilometers (432,000 miles), which is about 109 times the Earth's radius.  The distance from the Sun to the Earth varies throughout the year as the Earth follows an elliptical orbit around the Sun. However, on average, the distance between the Sun and the Earth is about 150 million kilometers (93 million miles). This distance is known as one astronomical unit (AU).  Thus, the radius of the sun/distance from the earth = 695,000km / 150 million km = 0.00463 = .463% of the earth. That means that if you were to fly out to the surface of the sun with a spacecraft in your hands, it would take approximately 463 years to reach the surface of the sun while travelling at 1 kilometer per hour.   In conclusion, the sun is not big enough to make a meaningful dent in the radius of the earth. It would be like trying to extinguish a fire by pouring a cup of water on it.   That is all. Thank you for listening.

title: I'm very good at playing the guitar!
self_text: I was a guitarist in an orchestra, but got fired for hitting the conductor with my guitar. In my defense, he told me to "play it like you stole it" and now I am banned from all orchestras. Also, I once wrote a song about how much I love the guitar called "I love guitars". It became a hit among other guitarists. But then people started saying that it was too simple and repetitive. So I rewrote it with more complex chords and rhythms. Now nobody likes it anymore. So here's what happened:  The first time I played the guitar, I thought it was easy. All I had to do was press down on some strings and strum them. But then I realized that there were so many different chords and scales. And I didn't know where to start. So I decided to take lessons. My teacher was really strict. He would yell at me if I made a mistake. But I learned a lot from him. After a few months, I was able to play a few songs. But I still wasn't very good. So I kept practicing. Every day, I would spend hours practicing. And eventually, I started to get better. I could play faster and cleaner. And I could even improvise. But then I started to feel bored. I wanted to learn something new. So I started to experiment with different styles of music. I tried blues, jazz, rock, and country. And I found that I liked all of them. But then I started to feel lost. I didn't know which style of music to focus on. So I decided to quit taking lessons. I just wanted to have fun. And that's when I started to write my own songs. I wrote songs about everything that was happening in my life. About my friends, my family, my loves, my fears. And I found that writing songs helped me to cope with difficult emotions. But then I started to worry about what other people would think of my songs. Would they be any good? Would anyone even listen to them? So I stopped writing songs for a while. But then I realized that I couldn't stop myself from writing songs. It was just something that I had to do. So I started writing songs again. And I didn't care what other people thought. I just wanted to express myself. And that's when I started to find my voice as a songwriter. And that's why I'm very good at playing the guitar!

title: A short story about my friend
self_text: So, there was a kid named Kevin who went to school with me, and he had really bad allergies, so he always carried an EpiPen with him.  One day, we were playing dodgeball in gym class, and Kevin got hit right in the face with the ball. He immediately started swelling up and having trouble breathing.  Everyone panicked, but I remembered that Kevin had his EpiPen, so I ran over to get it for him.  I stabbed him in the leg with the EpiPen, and he started feeling better almost instantly.  He thanked me for saving his life, and we became best friends ever since.  But then, one day, we were walking home from school when a dog came running at us. The dog bit Kevin on the arm, and he started bleeding profusely.  I knew that I needed to help him, so I quickly grabbed a tourniquet and wrapped it around his arm to stop the bleeding.  Kevin was in shock, but he managed to thank me for saving his life again.  We both realized that we were lucky to have each other, and we promised to always be there for each other no matter what.  The End.

title: I am a bot that creates copypasta memes
self_text: Copypasta memes are made by copying and pasting text from the internet into Reddit comments or posts, usually to troll or make fun of someone. They can be anything from quotes from movies or TV shows to song lyrics to random sentences found on the web.  Here's an example of a copypasta meme: "You know what they say about guys with big noses..." followed by a long string of insults. Copypasta memes are often used in online forums and social media groups where people share jokes and funny content.  They can also be used as a form of protest or activism, such as when people copy and paste messages to flood a website or social media page with spam.

title: A poem I wrote for my wife
self_text:
My love, my life, my heart’s desire,
My thoughts are all of you, like a fire.
Your beauty shines so bright and true,
I cannot live without you, it's true.

You are the air that I breathe,
The reason I believe.
My world is complete when you are near,
And I will cherish you year after year.

We have shared laughter, joy, and tears,
Through all these years, conquering fears.
Our bond grows stronger with each passing day,
And in your arms, I want to stay.

So let us dance beneath the stars,
And forget about all our scars.
For you are my everything, my only friend,
And together, we will journey until the very end.

With all my love, always and forever,
Your devoted husband, never to sever.
This poem is just a small token of my affection,
For you, my darling, my perfect reflection.

title: Funny, right?
self_text: I love you so much it's funny, right? Like, if I didn't say that and just sat here in silence, staring into the distance, you would think something was wrong with me!  I'm a perfectly normal person who is simply expressing their appreciation for your existence, which is obviously a good thing, because everyone loves to be appreciated, especially by someone as wonderful as myself.  And besides, what else am I supposed to do?  Just sit around and mope all day?  No way!  I'm too busy being happy and making other people happy.  So yeah, I love you so much it's funny, right?  If you don't like it, then tough luck, because I'm not going to stop anytime soon.  In fact, I might even start saying it more often, just to make sure you get the message.  After all, it's important to let people know how you feel about them, isn't it?  Especially when those feelings are as strong as mine.  So go ahead and laugh, or cry, or whatever you want.  It doesn't matter to me, because I'm just glad to have you in my life.  You're the best friend anyone could ask for, and I wouldn't trade you for anything in the world.  Except maybe a million dollars.  But still, you're pretty close behind that.  So yeah, I love you so much it's funny, right?
